pullrequest.title: Don't shut down gazebo when removing a world -> gazebo7

content.raw:
I think it looks ok to me. `SensorManager::worlds` gets modified in the following places:

* populated with `physics::get_world()` (the default world?) in `SensorManager::Update` if worlds is empty and worlds are running
* populated with `physics::get_world(_worldName)` in `SensorManager::CreateSensor` based on world name passed as function argument
* cleared during `SensorManager::Update` if `removeAllSensors` is true
* cleared during `SensorManager::Stop`
* cleared during `SensorManager::Fini`

I think it's reasonable to clear the worlds when removing sensors, since the worlds get added when sensors are created.
